Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None

Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased GGT liver enzyme
Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Non smoker
Restarted exercising
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Non smoker
Restarted exercising
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: 0

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased GGT liver enzyme
Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased GGT liver enzyme
Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations:

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Report Date: 2020-12-01

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

Employee: Theo Thomas

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations:

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Increased GGT liver enzyme, increased cholesterol and triglycerides, increased uric acid, normal but above optimal homocysteine

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Increased GGT liver enzyme, increased cholesterol and triglycerides, increased uric acid, normal but above optimal homocysteine

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Increased GGT liver enzyme, increased cholesterol and triglycerides, increased uric acid, normal but above optimal homocysteine
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Increased GGT liver enzyme, increased cholesterol and triglycerides, increased uric acid, normal but above optimal homocysteine
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Increased GGT liver enzyme, increased cholesterol and triglycerides, increased uric acid, normal but above optimal homocysteine
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Increased GGT liver enzyme, increased cholesterol and triglycerides, increased uric acid, normal but above optimal homocysteine

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations:

Women's Health Recommendations:

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Women's Health Recommendations:

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased GGT liver enzyme
Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased GGT liver enzyme
Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

Report Date: 2020-12-01

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

Employee: Theo Thomas

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Restarted exercising

Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations:

Increased cholesterol and triglycerides

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations:

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Continue health screening, pay attention to the conditions that have occurred in your family.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Women's Health Recommendations:

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Continue health screening, pay attention to the conditions that have occurred in your family.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Continue health screening, pay attention to the conditions that have occurred in your family.
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations:

Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Women's Health Recommendations:

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Uric Acid: reduce red meat and alcohol intake
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation

Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased GGT liver enzyme
Increased cholesterol and triglycerides
Increased uric acid
Normal but above optimal homocysteine
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Clinical Recommendations: No abnormalities
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Non smoker
Restarted exercising

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Liver enzymes: keep alcohol consumption to a minimum and lose some abdominal weight. Repeat levels in 3 months.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Homocysteine levels: supplement with active B12, B2, B6 and folate to reduce levels (This can be achieved by taking a good multivitamin like phytomulti from metagenics)
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Strong family history of heart disease on your father's side with young heart attacks and high cholesterol. Your diet has improved since lockdown but consider adding more vegetables. Try and reduce your waist circumference to below 94cm, now that you are able to exercise again this will help.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: -Pay attention to any changes to your urinary patterns & sexual function. Continue with your urology reviews.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.

Comment Value: None

------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: -Continue annual screening. Monitor your cholesterol levels bi-annually.
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: 0
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
------------------------------
Employee: Theo Thomas
Report Date: 2020-12-01
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: PSA testing annually from age 40. Elevated PSA level doesn't necessarily indicate prostate cancer. Other conditions, such as benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) and prostate infections, can also lead to increased PSA levels
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol levels: to try manage with lifestyle only. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat blood after 3 months. Increased triglycerides can be caused by too many refined carbohydrates in the diet so try to eliminate refined carbohydrates and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: Nil
